descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://img545.imageshack.us/img545/1240/m6vv.png[/img][/center]

Recent Compatibility patches for [b]SkyRe 1.3.01[/b] Includes: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27092]Balbor's[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29375]Qotsafan's[/url] stats.xml changes + the below stats.xml changes and patches.

If you want an original copy of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27092]Balbor's[/url] or [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29375]Qotsafan's[/url] stats.xml, or any of their patches, you may find them in the posted links. A few of my patches work hand in hand with Qotsafan's. See Readme for details.

This is a collection of patches aimed at making the exceptional mods of Skyrim compatible with T3nd0s Skyrim Redone. I have made the patches for my own use, and thought I would share them with the Nexus Community. I know how hard it is to keep things updated for all the various mod authors and patches. Things are forever changing and evolving. I will always accept requests if they are within my scope to complete.

2) Let me know if you have improved on the patches, I will reupload and combine, to make a Master List of SkyRe patches.

3) Keep the distribution on the NEXUS Network.
author: Xathra

files.name: XML Edits Only
files.changelogHtml:
** The XML Edits Only optional file only reflects stats.xml changes. It does not contain any patches or replacer's. This file is not needed for the Main Download to function **

Added: Support for Orcrist the Goblin Cleaver.

This replacer ESP and stats.xml edits, adds the functionality of SkyRe Perks and values to all versions of Orcrist the Goblin Cleaver.
This is a replacer ESP only. Original files are required. (XML Edits Only) file reflects these changes. Main file is still needed for the replacer ESP.

Added: Support for Character Creation Overhaul. There are two versions:

- 1) is for use with SkyRe Standing Stones Module.

- 2) is for use with no SkyRe Standing Stones Module, instead using the Vanilla Standing Stones.

** These are replacer ESP's only. Original files are required.

Added: Support for Dragonpriest Dragonborn Circlets and Aetherial Crown. There are three versions:

- 1) is for use with the No Crown Complete Version of DDCA.

- 2) is for use with the Crown Complete Version of DDCA

- 3) is for use with the Crown Mage Ready Complete version of DDCA.

** These are replacer ESP's only. Original files are required. Any of the DDCA replacers should be placed last in the load order. They are hard coded with the ReProccer data for SkyRe Mask Values. They do not require the ReProccer to function. Akin to a "Post ReProccer patch".

files.name: Reproccer Patches SkyRe
files.changelogHtml:

Added: Support for Clothing and Clutter Fixes
Added: Support for 1.32 of Character Creation Overhaul

files.name: Pre ReProccer IA7 Patch
files.changelogHtml:
This is a two part patch for Immersive Armors 7, for use with T3nd0's Skyrim Redone and ReProccer.

-Pre ReProccer IA7 Patch.esp is to be loaded right before the ReProccer.esp and above the Dual Sheath Redux Patch.esp if you are using it. (It is a replacer for Qotsafans Pre ReProccer IA patch) (It contains all the previous data from that patch and all the new data.)

-Post ReProccer IA7 Patch.esp is to be loaded after the ReProccer, last in load order or below all other "ReProccer patches, i.e., reproccer dragonborn, reproccer skyforgedshields, etc. (This patch is a workaround for certain heavy and light materials, forcing them into the proper perk associations, armor values, and material entries.)

Some things to note:

- Do to the way SkyRe and the ReProccer handle item materials and perk assignments, the majority of the items in the auxiliary tab have been automatically moved out (by SkyRe) and back into their respective categories. This will impact the few helms from IA7 that are supposed to be combinable with multiple armors. Currently this is part of the SkyRe design and will eventually need a work around, or reprogramming.

-Note: Both sets of meltdown recipe's were left in to facilitate a choice in the IA7 MCM. You can turn off the IA7 meltodown, and you will have only SkyRe's, or you can leave it on. The downside is if you leave it on, you will have double meltdown entries. This is in no way game breaking. The meltdown ingredients are just different multiples of ingots for the most part.

-Feature: You now have some cool shield options. Because SkyRe keys off of Vanilla material keywords, I have engineerd a forcible portion of the patch to allow heavy material items that have light version give the appropriate light perks, and vice versa, just like the IA7 design. In essence you will find some light versions of heavy shields and heavy versions of light shields that will give you the proper affixed perks. It will be obvious they are tagd with Light and Heavy.

- Note: A lot of the armor and some of the shields have Custom Data for armor values and weight, and some of them share generic values based on their crafting materials. This can be tweaked and customized at a later date.

- Note: I would recommend not using the portion of the MCM that turns light armor into heavy armor and vice versa. This may break the ReProccer. The rest of the MCM menu for colors or placement in the world should work correctly.

-Final: There are going to be bugs. This is an alpha patch, only so much testing could be done in such a short time, it was done carefully but at breakneck speed, in order to facilitate it's long awaited release to the public. I ask that you remain professional and when reporting bugs (I prefer to receive them in my mailbox to keep clutter down on the threads, if you must leave something immediate, direct it to Tooplex while I am away) to give a detailed description of exactly what you are using, and what you are seeing as a bug or an error.

**If you reply with statements such as: You broke my game, It won't work, what is a.jar file, and have general blatant disregard for following instructions, you will be ignored. **

This patch did not break your game, aliens did not come down in the middle of the night and fry your CPU. Please do not waste mine or Tooplex's time. If you are not willing to take the time to make an informed decision, or have a semi coherent question with proper facts behind it, we can't help you. :D

This will impact the few helms from IA7 that are supposed to be combinable with multiple armors. Currently this is part of the SkyRe design and will eventually need a work around, or reprogramming.

-Note: Both sets of meltdown recipe's were left in to facilitate a choice in the IA7 MCM. You can turn off the IA7 meltodown, and you will have only SkyRe's, or you can leave it on. The downside is if you leave it on, you will have double meltdown entries. This is in no way game breaking. The meltdown ingredients are just different multiples of ingots for the most part.

-Feature: You now have some cool shield options. Because SkyRe keys off of Vanilla material keywords, I have engineerd a forcible portion of the patch to allow heavy material items that have light version give the appropriate light perks, and vice versa, just like the IA7 design. In essence you will find some light versions of heavy shields and heavy versions of light shields that will give you the proper affixed perks. It will be obvious they are tagd with Light and Heavy.

- Note: A lot of the armor and some of the shields have Custom Data for armor values and weight, and some of them share generic values based on their crafting materials. This can be tweaked and customized at a later date.

- Note: I would recommend not using the portion of the MCM that turns light armor into heavy armor and vice versa. This may break the ReProccer. The rest of the MCM menu for colors or placement in the world should work correctly.

-Final: There are going to be bugs. This is an alpha patch, only so much testing could be done in such a short time, it was done carefully but at breakneck speed, in order to facilitate it's long awaited release to the public. I ask that you remain professional and when reporting bugs (I prefer to receive them in my mailbox to keep clutter down on the threads, if you must leave something immediate, direct it to Tooplex while I am away) to give a detailed description of exactly what you are using, and what you are seeing as a bug or an error.

**If you reply with statements such as: You broke my game, It won't work, what is a.jar file, and have general blatant disregard for following instructions, you will be ignored. **

This patch did not break your game, aliens did not come down in the middle of the night and fry your CPU. Please do not waste mine or Tooplex's time. If you are not willing to take the time to make an informed decision, or have a semi coherent question with proper facts behind it, we can't help you. :D

files.name: Pre ReProccer WAFR IA7 IW Patch
files.fileName: Pre ReProccer WAFR IA7 IW Patch-48629-Beta.7z
files.changelogHtml:
This is a three part patch for Immersive Armors 7, and Immersive Weapons, for use with T3nd0's Skyrim Redone and ReProccer.

-Pre ReProccer IA7 Patch.esp is to be loaded right before the ReProccer.esp and above the Dual Sheath Redux Patch.esp if you are using it. (No longer requires Balbor or Qotsafan patches) (Requires Weapons and Armor Fixes by Kryptopyr)

-Post ReProccer IA7 Patch.esp is to be loaded after the ReProccer.(This patch now has all the necessary ReProccer data that was added by Balbor and Qotsafan) (This patch is a workaround for certain heavy and light materials, forcing them into the proper perk associations, armor values, and material entries.) (No longer requires any other ReProccer patches by Balbor or Qotsafan)

-Immersive Weapons.esp is a replacer esp file with some redacted items to silver weapons and leveled lists that were in conflict with SkyRe. Also some arrow data was changed to correct some category issues that were not done correctly. (Original file by Hothtrooper required for textures and meshes)

Some things to note:

- Do to the way SkyRe and the ReProccer handle item materials and perk assignments, the items in the auxiliary tab have been moved out, and back into their respective categories, and a new Silver Tab was put in its place. This was done to accommodate Weapons and Armor Fixes Redone, and the CCOR patches being made by Gruffys.

-Note: Both sets of meltdown recipe's were left in to facilitate a choice in the IA7 MCM. You can turn off the IA7 meltodown, and you will have only SkyRe's, or you can leave it on. The downside is if you leave it on, you will have double meltdown entries. This is in no way game breaking. The meltdown ingredients are just different multiples of ingots for the most part.

- If you don't use Weapons and Armor Fixes, too bad. I don't have time for 31 variants. Same goes for Immersive Weapons. IF and WHEN I have the time I will re-address this.

- I have not made a leveled lists patch for Immersive Weapons yet. I am extremely busy, and making all 4 files standalone, and not requiring any of Balbors/Qotsafan Patches was an extreme amount of work. If you want a leveled lists patch, you can wait, or you can donate your time to assisting me.

** I have not thoroughly tested the use of the old leveled lists patches. At a glance they appear to function. If this is not the case please let me know. I am still looking for someone to assist with Leveled Lists patching, as I am very busy. **

- I have not provided any support for ASIS or Automatic Variants. You will need to go to Qotsafan for that. I do not use them, and at current, do not have time to start another big project.

- I have not done a CCOR aMidianSS Variants version yet. This will come after Gruffys has time to look the new patches over.

As I stated in my posts repeatedly, I do not have time to make 31 variants of patches right now so don't ask. It was pain in the ass enough to integrate all the other mod authors previous patches.

I will get to it, when I get to it.

files.name: Pre ReProccer WAFR IA7 aMidianSS Content Addon Patch CCOR
files.fileName: Pre ReProccer WAFR IA7 aMidianSS Content Addon Patch CCOR version-48629-CCOR.7z
files.changelogHtml:
Added: Compatibility for Complete Crafting Overhaul Remade. (CCOR Main files are required) 12 additonal Patches.
Gruffy's CCOR_SkyRe_Patch.esp is referenced as a Master FIle, and is required. You may find it here: http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50343
There are 6 versions with Immersive Weapons and 6 version without Immersive Weapons.
The CCOR versions are applied exactly the same as any other patch in the WAFR IA7 series. Help thread for the IA7 series is located in the topsticky post.

files.name: Bishu and Fudou Swords by China-YYK Moral cat
files.fileName: Bishu and Fudou Swords by China-YYK Moral cat-48629-LessPower.7z
files.changelogHtml:
Adjusted values and crafting materials for Skyre. Appropriate perks assigned.

These files contain information pertinent to the Less Powerful versions of both sets of weapons.

Any further tweaking of weapon damage can be accomplished by changing the values present in the XML under "Bishu" and "Fudou", using Notepad++, as shown below.

<weapon_material>
<iDamage>3</iDamage>
<sMaterialName>Bishu</sMaterialName>
</weapon_material>
<weapon_material>
<iDamage>4</iDamage>
<sMaterialName>Fudou</sMaterialName>
</weapon_material>


Original files are required for textures and meshes.

If any one is using Weapons and armor fixes remade, you can easily edit the replacer esp I am providing, and add in the appropriate WAFR keywords and remove the jewelry keywords from the esp (all mage circlets), if you wish to align the mage circlets into other categories, such as: "Clothing", etc.

files.name: Reproccer Patches SkyRe
files.changelogHtml:
All changes made have been documented in multiple readme files, that will be installed via the main FOMOD and the USKRP FOMOD installer's, depending on which modules you install. There is also valuable information given during the FOMOD installer screen selection process.

The main FOMOD does come with a stats.xml file, but you will always find the most recent stats.xml available as a separate download, under the main section. This will always be the most recent copy of all stats.xml data. If ever in question, download the standalone stats.xml file.

The USKRP is now an ongoing project here and will continue to receive updates as necessary.
